name: CoRoT-28
scenarioDescription:
The CoRoT-28 Exoplanetary System


Overview

CoRoT-28 is a star with 1.01 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.78 times its radius. It is located 1826.47 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 12 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

CoRoT-28 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the CoRoT-28 system


CoRoT-28 b

CoRoT-28 b was discovered by the CoRoT observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of CoRoT-28 b is 153.912 times the mass of Earth. The radius of CoRoT-28 b is 10.705 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, CoRoT-28 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system CoRoT-28, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by CoRoT.
